titleStmt.title: The great & bloody visions, interpreted by Arise Evans fore-telling the strange and wonderful things that will befall the Common wealth of England, Scotland, and Ireland, the establishing of a glorious government under His Highness the Lord Protector, and the setling of peace and happiness in all these dominions : likewise, the restoring of the churches from defiling and robbing, and the preserving of all sacred rites and ordinances belonging to those glorious sanctuaries and Christian temples : together with the signification of the coming in of the white doves : the appearing of Charles's Wain, the dissolution of tyranny, the restoring all men to their just rights, and pristine liberties, and the vanishing away of all oppressors, traytors and tyrants.
titleStmt.author: Evans, Arise, b. 1607.

titleStmt.title: The great & bloody visions, interpreted by Arise Evans fore-telling the strange and wonderful things that will befall the Common wealth of England, Scotland, and Ireland, the establishing of a glorious government under His Highness the Lord Protector, and the setling of peace and happiness in all these dominions : likewise, the restoring of the churches from defiling and robbing, and the preserving of all sacred rites and ordinances belonging to those glorious sanctuaries and Christian temples : together with the signification of the coming in of the white doves : the appearing of Charles's Wain, the dissolution of tyranny, the restoring all men to their just rights, and pristine liberties, and the vanishing away of all oppressors, traytors and tyrants.
titleStmt.author: Evans, Arise, b. 1607.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
